August 17, 1961
Mr. Carl H. Menzer,
Director, WSUI and KSUI (PM>
State University of Iowa
Iowa City, Iowa
Dear Carls
Thank you for your letter of August 14. There is an allotment in the bud¬
get of $100 per region which, is to he used to help underwrite the expenses
of a regional meeting. However, since not all of your regional members will
be attending the Convention, I think it would be rather unfair to use this
$100 to cover an expense related to the Convention. It would seem to me a
better idea if this money were used at a regional meeting which permitted
members both attending the Convention and not attending the Convention to
get together.
She Madison SeraAnar Report will be sent to all Active and Associate members.
However, the preparation of the Report has been delayed since Betty McKenzie
is swamped with last minute plans for the September special issue of the
Newsletter, and is also waiting to hear from Harley on several points to be
included in the Seminar Report. I don't think we can possibly get the Re¬
port out until after the Convention which means that neither the Board nor
the other members will have a chance to see the Report before the meeting.
However, the Seminar may be discussed at one of the business meetings at the
Convention.
As for the possibility of a Regional IV meeting-- Monday morning, October 23,
has been set aside for comaittee meetings, however this would conflict with
the Board meeting which you and John would have to attend. Tuesday evening
is the only open evening, but since this is the only free night, it might not
be feasible to meet then. Of course, Thursday evening, the 26th, sill be
open after the close of the Convention, but there is a tour planned after the
adjourmnent of the Convention which some of your regional members might be
planning to go on.
His leaves the possibility of a luncheon meeting, and if you are interested
in this, Monday, the 23rd and also Wednesday, the 25th, are open. If you should
decide to meet on one of these days, you should make arrangementw with the
l&rriott for the meal, room, etc.
